üéØ Denali Tech Website - Comprehensive Improvement Plan

Your Website is Your Business - Let's Make It Perfect

This document outlines a strategic plan to make your website the best it can be for generating leads and serving your customers.

‚úÖ COMPLETED IMPROVEMENTS (Today)

1. Testimonials Display ‚úì

  • ‚úÖ Changed from carousel to 3-column grid (matches "What We Do" section)
  • ‚úÖ Better visual consistency across the site
  • ‚úÖ Shows 3 testimonials at once on desktop

2. Removed Price Estimator ‚úì

  • ‚úÖ Removed cost estimator (home automation pricing is too variable)
  • ‚úÖ Better to guide customers to free consultation instead

3. Smart Phone Button Placement ‚úì

  • ‚úÖ Desktop: Header "Call Now" button (always visible)
  • ‚úÖ Mobile: Floating call button (appears after scrolling)
  • ‚úÖ Mobile Menu: "Call Now" link
  • ‚úÖ Footer: Phone number in contact section
  • ‚úÖ No redundancy - each serves a purpose

üéØ SHORT-TERM PRIORITIES (Next 1-2 Weeks)

1. Content & Trust Building

  • [ ] Real Customer Testimonials: Replace sample testimonials with real ones from Google Reviews
  • [ ] Add More FAQs: Based on common customer questions you receive
  • [ ] Case Studies: Add 2-3 detailed project case studies with photos
  • [ ] Video Content: Add short (30-60 sec) videos showing installations

2. Lead Generation Optimization

  • [ ] Multiple Contact Points:
    • Keep booking form prominent
    • Add quick contact buttons in strategic places
    • Consider adding calendar booking integration (Calendly)
  • [ ] Exit Intent Popup: Capture visitors who are about to leave
  • [ ] Phone Number Tracking: Track which phone button gets more clicks

3. SEO & Discoverability

  • [ ] Local SEO:
    • Add more Chicago neighborhood mentions
    • Create location-specific landing pages for major areas
    • Get more Google Reviews (aim for 20+)
  • [ ] Blog Section:
    • Start with 3-5 helpful articles
    • "Smart Home Tips for Chicago Winters"
    • "How to Choose the Right Home Automation System"
    • "Home Theater Setup Guide"

üìä MEDIUM-TERM GOALS (1-3 Months)

1. Enhanced User Experience

  • [ ] Project Gallery Enhancement:
    • Before/After photos
    • Filter by service type
    • Detailed project descriptions
  • [ ] Virtual Consultation Booking:
    • Add calendar integration
    • Allow customers to choose time slots
    • Automatic confirmation emails
  • [ ] Live Chat Integration:
    • Set up Tawk.to (free) or similar
    • Respond to common questions
    • Capture leads instantly

2. Content Marketing

  • [ ] Blog Strategy:
    • Publish 1-2 articles per month
    • Target local keywords
    • Share on social media
  • [ ] Video Library:
    • Service explanation videos
    • Installation process videos
    • Customer testimonial videos
  • [ ] Social Proof:
    • Display Google Review widget
    • Show recent projects
    • Highlight certifications

3. Technical Improvements

  • [ ] Performance Optimization:
    • Compress images further
    • Optimize loading speed
    • Improve mobile performance
  • [ ] Analytics Setup:
    • Google Analytics 4
    • Track form submissions
    • Monitor user behavior
    • Set up conversion goals

üöÄ LONG-TERM VISION (3-6 Months)

1. Advanced Features

  • [ ] Customer Portal:
    • Login for existing customers
    • View project status
    • Request service/support
    • Access manuals and guides
  • [ ] Quote Builder Tool:
    • Interactive service selector
    • Rough estimate generator
    • Email quote option
  • [ ] Referral Program:
    • Track referrals
    • Reward customers
    • Generate word-of-mouth

2. Marketing Automation

  • [ ] Email Marketing:
    • Newsletter with tips
    • Follow-up sequences
    • Special offers
  • [ ] Retargeting:
    • Facebook/Google ads for visitors
    • Show relevant services
  • [ ] Social Media Integration:
    • Instagram feed
    • Facebook reviews
    • Recent posts

3. Business Growth Tools

  • [ ] CRM Integration:
    • Connect forms to CRM
    • Track leads automatically
    • Follow-up reminders
  • [ ] Online Scheduling:
    • Full calendar integration
    • Automatic reminders
    • Time zone handling
  • [ ] Payment Processing:
    • Accept deposits online
    • Payment plans
    • Invoice system

üîç ANALYTICS & MEASUREMENT

Key Metrics to Track

  1. Traffic:

    • Total visitors
    • New vs returning
    • Traffic sources
    • Popular pages

  2. Engagement:

    • Time on site
    • Pages per visit
    • Bounce rate
    • Scroll depth

  3. Conversions:

    • Form submissions
    • Phone calls
    • Consultation bookings
    • Email signups

  4. Business Goals:

    • Leads generated
    • Conversion rate
    • Cost per lead
    • ROI on website

üí° QUICK WINS (Do These First)

  1. Add Real Testimonials (1 hour)

    • Copy from Google Reviews
    • Get permission if needed
    • Add photos if possible

  2. Optimize Contact Forms (30 min)

    • Test form submissions
    • Add thank you page
    • Set up email notifications

  3. Add More FAQs (1 hour)

    • List common questions
    • Add to FAQ section
    • Update structured data

  4. Set Up Google Analytics (30 min)

    • Install tracking code
    • Set up goals
    • Start tracking

  5. Mobile Testing (1 hour)

    • Test on real devices
    • Fix any issues
    • Optimize touch targets

üéØ SUCCESS METRICS

3-Month Goals

  • Traffic: Increase by 50%
  • Leads: Generate 20+ leads/month
  • Conversion Rate: 3-5% (industry average: 2-3%)
  • Google Reviews: 20+ reviews
  • Page Speed: 90+ on mobile (PageSpeed Insights)

6-Month Goals

  • Traffic: Increase by 100%
  • Leads: Generate 40+ leads/month
  • Conversion Rate: 5-7%
  • Google Reviews: 50+ reviews
  • Blog: 10+ articles published
  • Social Media: 500+ followers

üí™ FINAL THOUGHTS

Your website is a crucial part of your business. Every improvement should:

  1. Help customers find what they need
  2. Build trust and credibility
  3. Generate leads and bookings
  4. Save you time with automation
  5. Grow your business consistently

Remember: Small, consistent improvements beat big overhauls. Focus on what works, test everything, and always put your customers first.
